data.title: Not the best but definitely far from the worst.
data.text:
Why is it that every single teriyaki restaurant I visit has sticky tables? I'm talking about every one of them too! Is it the way the food is cooked? The way they clean things? I just don't understand it. With that said however, this place gets 3 stars. It's on the bottom of my list of teriyaki places but it's still on the list and I actually return to places that are on my list.

Dark meat chicken was charred well and delicious. They served me a bowl of soup as an appetizer for dining in. The gyoza was good as well as the salad. The salad dressing was good not great and the teriyaki sauce was a little off but I don't have any major complaints about anything. My food was delivered quickly and was a good temperature. The staff was friendly and treated me well. 

I choose my teriyaki restaurants based on my rating of them first and then by their location to wherever I may be at the time. I chose this one while my car was being repaired and it turned out to be a good decision. I will be back when I am in the area and looking for a teriyaki meal. 

My only request is for the restaurant to add Sriracha sauce with their condiments. I did use the hot sauce they provided but I'd prefer Sriracha instead or at least the option. 

Thanks for reading.

data.title: Hidden Jewel, for Teriyaki and fried rice - Best Customer service
data.text: Very happy, kind family run business.  I go out of my way to support.  excellent food and service with a smile.  I usually order to go, but do stay on occasion.  Dishes are made fresh with good ingredients.

data.title: Dinner was great
data.text: I know these Teriyaki places can be run of the mill type but I liked this place. Great music and such pleasant service with a beautiful smile. Gotta like all that.
